content: Choose the right carbohydrates. Simple carbs, like raw sugar or corn syrup, are quickly absorbed by the body's digestive system. This causes a kind of carb overload, and your body releases huge amounts of insulin, to combat the overload. Eat these in moderation. Complex carbs, on the other hand, are slowly digested and absorbed by the body because they have at least three sugar molecules. They include whole-grain flour, hearty vegetables, oats, and unprocessed grains, like brown rice. These foods are usually higher in vitamins and other nutrients that are beneficial for the body, and they are higher in fiber (which keeps your digestive system running smoothly). Consider eating dark leafy greens like kale, collard greens, mustard greens, and Swiss chard. They are packed with nutrients and will fill you up very quickly. Create a simple sauté with olive oil, garlic, and a little salt and pepper, which will be surprisingly tasty meal as well as a nutritious one. Choose wheat (brown) bread instead of white bread and whole wheat pasta instead of "normal" pasta. Processed carbohydrates, such as those found in white bread, do not have many of nutrients or the fiber found in whole grains. Plain oatmeal is also very healthy for you. Eat lean protein foods. Aim to get between 10% and 35% of your daily calories from protein. [1] Protein helps you build muscle and gives you a steady supply of energy throughout the day. Some examples of healthy proteins include: Lean fish such as tilapia , flounder , sole , cod , bass , perch , and halibut . Lean poultry such as chicken or duck breast. Legumes like beans and soy products (e.g. edamame and tofu). Nuts like cashews. Know the difference between good fat and bad fat. You need to consume fat for your body to function correctly. However, it's important to choose the right kind of fats. Here's a quick primer. Monounsaturated fats and omega-3 fatty acids are good fats, which you should try to consume regularly. They help lower the "bad cholesterol" in your body by raising "good cholesterol". Foods that are high in fatty acids are olive oil, nuts, fish oil, and various seed oils. Adding these "good" fats to your weekly diet can lower your cholesterol and reduce your risk of heart disease. Avoid trans fats and saturated fats. Trans fats, also known as partially hydrogenated oils, are a form of unsaturated fat commonly found in processed foods. Consuming them raises your risk of heart disease. Read the labels of what you eat, and look for "hydrogenated" anything on the ingredient list. Stock up on superfoods. So-called superfoods may have a misleading title, but some truly are cut above. Superfoods may have the ability to fight heart disease, stave off cancer, lower cholesterol, and even boost your mood. [2] Here are just few of them: Blueberries. Blueberries may facilitate brain health. [3] If you don't have access to blueberries, then try fresh berries, raspberries, or cranberries. Algae. It may not sound appetizing, but when you read the list of health benefits you may think again. It is rich in vitamins, minerals, and amino acids, as well as beneficial in managing natural flora in the gut. Salmon. Another creature of the sea makes the list, and for good reason. Salmon is rich in omega-3 fatty acids, a good type of fat. Omega-3 fats are good for blood pressure, brain function, and heart health. Cranberries. These red berries contain quercetin , a natural antioxidant, are low in sugar and are a good source of Vitamin C which is used for the growth and repair of tissue all over the body. Watch your salt intake. [4] Although humans need salt in moderation, too much salt can lead to high blood pressure and osteoporosis . [5] Use salt sparingly, and always check labels for salt content. Practice moderation. Don't over-consume any one food or type of food. Instead, try to vary your diet so that you eat a little bit of everything in a moderate amount. Some people might be great at giving up meat, sugar, alcohol, or other foods. However, most of us are likely to give it up for a while, then break down and binge. Avoid this deprivation-binge cycle by allowing yourself to have small "cheats". For instance, if you want to eat less sugar, allow yourself to eat one dessert each Friday night and abstain for the rest of the week. Having a break to look forward, which can help your will power through the other days. Drink plenty of water . Staying hydrated with basic H 2 O is an easy and dramatic way to improve your health. Drinking enough water can also help with weight loss by keeping your stomach feeling full. Drink water before, during and after a meal to aid digestion. [6] [7] If you feel like snacking, try drinking a full glass of water first. If you're still hungry 15 minutes after your drink, then it's time for a snack. Carry water with you so you can easily pick it up when you're thirsty. Avoid sugary drinks. These include soft drinks, juices, sports and energy drinks, as well as other products containing artificial sweeteners. Giving up sugary drinks is one of the easiest ways you can instantly improve your diet and become healthier. A white chocolate crème frappuccino has whopping 500 calories. [8] While it's okay to treat yourself with these and other drinks every once in a while, it's not a good idea to make them a regular part of your diet. Consider participating in Meatless Mondays . Meatless Monday is an international campaign that encourages people to give up eating meat one day per week. Eating less meat can have several health benefits, as most people already have enough protein in their diets. Stay away from fast food. As we all know fast food is bad for our health, yet it continues to remain a weekly staple for too many people. For one, fast food is often fried, processed, and excessively salty. Add soft drinks and fries and your meal could easily burn through half of your suggested caloric intake for the day. To add insult to injury, much of the fat contained in fast food is trans-fat, the worst kind of fat. [9] Reduce your alcohol intake. Excessive alcohol consumption makes you gain weight and is hard for the liver to process leading to a host of preventable diseases. Drinking in moderation is key, if you do consume alcohol, consider drink a glass of wine or beer with your meal as opposed to multiple drinks at a bar. Red wine, in particular, contains polyphenol, called resveratrol that scientists believe is particularly heart-healthy. Resveratrol improves the function of blood vessels in the heart and curbs the amount of "bad" cholesterol in your body. [10] Are you pregnant and worried about drinking? Doctors recommend expectant mothers to abstain from alcohol. Adopt a healthy attitude towards food. Take a hard look at your eating habits. Do you eat more when you feel stressed? [11] Do you withhold food from yourself in order to feel like you're in control? Try to evaluate whether you have an unhealthy emotional attachment to food. If you do, here are few steps to consider: Find a healthier replacement. If you find that you tend to gorge on unhealthy foods when you're stressed, find a substitute activity — for instance, you could instead go for a walk, take a long bath, or call a trusted friend for a chat. Whatever you choose, it should be something that helps you to decompress, so that you no longer feel the need to binge. See food as sustenance. A lot of Western culture is rife with messages that food is for entertainment or for relieving boredom. Break yourself of this cognitive habit by consciously evaluating food in terms of what it can do to keep your body healthy. Ask yourself if what you're about to put in your mouth is good for you, and if it will help your body function as it was designed to. Consult a medical professional. Eating disorders are classified as mental illnesses, and you can't always just talk yourself into stopping destructive behaviors. [12] If you suspect that you have an eating disorder (whether it's over- or under-eating), ask your general practitioner to refer you the appropriate care. Determine how many calories your body needs to function each day. This number can vary widely, depending upon your metabolism and how physically active you are. As a rule, the more muscle mass you have, the more calories you need to consume and to function properly. Otherwise, your body will start breaking down muscle tissue for energy. If you're the kind of person who puts on 10 pounds just smelling a slice of pizza, then your daily caloric intake should stay around 2000 calories for men, and 1500 calories for women. Your body mass also plays a part in this — more calories are suitable for naturally bigger people, and fewer calories for smaller people. If you're the kind of person who can eat without putting on a pound, or you're physically active, you may want to increase your daily caloric intake by 1000-2000 calories, a little less for women. Don't skip breakfast . Many people do this because they think they can drop pound, or they just don't feel hungry in the morning. Although the scientific evidence is still inconclusive [13] , there are several reasons why you might not want to skip what many people believe is the "most important meal of the day". Eating breakfast gets your metabolism going and keeps it active throughout the morning. This will keep you energized throughout the morning. Skipping breakfast might leave you famished by lunch, causing you to binge as a way to compensate. A small breakfast is better than no breakfast. If you don't feel up to a full meal, at least drink some water and eat a piece of fruit, a granola bar, or a piece of toast. Get more nutritious bang for your buck by eating a breakfast smoothie . Avoid skipping breakfast at the day of an important exam, job interview, or other critical event, where you may be distracted by your hunger or not have enough energy for your brain to work to its full potential. Eat slowly. Have you ever gorged on a huge meal and felt fine immediately after, but felt like exploding 15 minutes later? This happens because it takes some time for your stomach to tell your brain that it's full. Circumvent the problem by consuming your food slower. That way, by the time you get the message and start feeling satisfied, you haven't consumed extra food. Slow yourself down by waiting 5 or 10 minutes between each course. Chew each bite thoroughly Drink a full glass of water throughout your meal. Stopping for sips will slow your eating, as well as help you feel more full. Put your fork down between bites. This is a physical reminder to finish the food in your mouth before taking another bite. Eat five times per day. You may consider eating three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner), with two snacks in between. Doing this allows you to eat slightly less at your meals, giving your body a more manageable amount of food to digest, and keeps your blood sugar at a consistent level throughout the day.

<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy">How to Eat Healthy</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="expert_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Patricia Somers, RD</a>
</div>

<div id="sp_icon_body">
		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=patriciasomers%2Crd#patriciasomers%2Crd">Patricia Somers, RD</a>. Patricia Somers is a Registered Dietitian in Arkansas. She received her RD from the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics in 1979.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">13 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>Changing how you eat is a major step on the road to getting fit. There’s more to a balanced diet than simply eating your fruits and vegetables, so knowing what foods to look out for will help you create a nutrition plan that strengthens your body and makes you feel far happier.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Choosing_a_Healthy_Diet_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Choosing_a_Healthy_Diet">Choosing a Healthy Diet</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_6178ea538e" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6178ea538e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose the right carbohydrates.</b> Simple carbs, like raw sugar or corn syrup, are quickly absorbed by the body's digestive system. This causes a kind of carb overload, and your body releases huge amounts of insulin, to combat the overload. Eat these in moderation. Complex carbs, on the other hand, are slowly digested and absorbed by the body because they have at least three sugar molecules. They include whole-grain flour, hearty vegetables, oats, and unprocessed grains, like brown rice. These foods are usually higher in vitamins and other nutrients that are beneficial for the body, and they are higher in fiber (which keeps your digestive system running smoothly).

<ul>
<li>Consider eating dark leafy greens like kale, collard greens, mustard greens, and Swiss chard. They are packed with nutrients and will fill you up very quickly. Create a simple sauté with olive oil, garlic, and a little salt and pepper, which will be surprisingly tasty meal as well as a nutritious one.
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet1.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet1.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 1Bullet1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet1.jpg" height="485" id="img_7bdebbc047" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7bdebbc047')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 1Bullet1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet1.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
<li>Choose wheat (brown) bread instead of white bread and whole wheat pasta instead of "normal" pasta. Processed carbohydrates, such as those found in white bread, do not have many of nutrients or the fiber found in whole grains. Plain oatmeal is also very healthy for you.
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 1Bullet2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet2.jpg" height="485" id="img_351ff2e3b4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_351ff2e3b4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 1Bullet2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1Bullet2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Eat lean protein foods.</b> Aim to get between 10% and 35% of your daily calories from protein.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup> Protein helps you build muscle and gives you a steady supply of energy throughout the day. Some examples of healthy proteins include:
<ul>
<li>Lean fish such as <a href="/Cook-Tilapia" title="Cook Tilapia">tilapia</a>, <a href="/Cook-Flounder" title="Cook Flounder">flounder</a>, <a href="/Cook-Lemon-Sole" title="Cook Lemon Sole">sole</a>, <a href="/Cook-Cod" title="Cook Cod">cod</a>, <a href="/Cook-Sea-Bass" title="Cook Sea Bass">bass</a>, <a href="/Cook-Perch" title="Cook Perch">perch</a>, and <a href="/Cook-Halibut" title="Cook Halibut">halibut</a>.
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet1.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet1.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet1.jpg" height="485" id="img_f5db9102bb" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f5db9102bb')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet1.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
<li>Lean poultry such as chicken or duck breast.
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet2.jpg" height="485" id="img_2fc0392d5f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2fc0392d5f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
<li>Legumes like beans and soy products (e.g. edamame and tofu).
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet3.jpg" height="485" id="img_dfa7c16139" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_dfa7c16139')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
<li>Nuts like cashews.
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet4.jpg" height="485" id="img_add8da5a8a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_add8da5a8a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 2Bullet4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2Bullet4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_0939e2857c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0939e2857c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Know the difference between good fat and bad fat.</b> You need to consume fat for your body to function correctly. However, it's important to choose the right kind of fats. Here's a quick primer.

<ul>
<li>Monounsaturated fats and omega-3 fatty acids are good fats, which you should try to consume regularly. They help lower the "bad cholesterol" in your body by raising "good cholesterol". Foods that are high in fatty acids are olive oil, nuts, fish oil, and various seed oils. Adding these "good" fats to your weekly diet can lower your cholesterol and reduce your risk of heart disease.</li>
<li>Avoid trans fats and saturated fats. Trans fats, also known as partially hydrogenated oils, are a form of unsaturated fat commonly found in processed foods. Consuming them raises your risk of heart disease. Read the labels of what you eat, and look for "hydrogenated" anything on the ingredient list.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_7cb568bc80" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7cb568bc80')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stock up on superfoods.</b> So-called superfoods may have a misleading title, but some truly are cut above. Superfoods may have the ability to fight heart disease, stave off cancer, lower cholesterol, and even boost your mood.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup> Here are just few of them:

<ul>
<li>Blueberries. Blueberries may facilitate brain health.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup> If you don't have access to blueberries, then try fresh berries, raspberries, or cranberries.</li>
<li>Algae. It may not sound appetizing, but when you read the list of health benefits you may think again. It is rich in vitamins, minerals, and amino acids, as well as beneficial in managing natural flora in the gut.</li>
<li>Salmon. Another creature of the sea makes the list, and for good reason. Salmon is rich in omega-3 fatty acids, a good type of fat. Omega-3 fats are good for blood pressure, brain function, and heart health.</li>
<li>Cranberries. These red berries contain <i>quercetin</i>, a natural antioxidant, are low in sugar and are a good source of Vitamin C which is used for the growth and repair of tissue all over the body.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_9d2efb94e1" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9d2efb94e1')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Watch your salt intake.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup> Although humans need salt in moderation, too much salt can lead to <a href="/Lower-Blood-Pressure" title="Lower Blood Pressure">high blood pressure</a> and <a href="/Prevent-Osteoporosis" title="Prevent Osteoporosis">osteoporosis</a>.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup> Use salt sparingly, and always check labels for salt content.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_efa1d16bfc" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_efa1d16bfc')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Practice moderation.</b> Don't over-consume any one food or type of food. Instead, try to vary your diet so that you eat a little bit of everything in a moderate amount.

<ul>
<li>Some people might be great at giving up meat, sugar, alcohol, or other foods. However, most of us are likely to give it up for a while, then break down and binge. Avoid this deprivation-binge cycle by allowing yourself to have small "cheats". For instance, if you want to eat less sugar, allow yourself to eat one dessert each Friday night and abstain for the rest of the week. Having a break to look forward, which can help your will power through the other days.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Making_Easy_but_Healthy_Decisions_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_Easy_but_Healthy_Decisions">Making Easy but Healthy Decisions</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_79c53ed8aa" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_79c53ed8aa')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Drink-More-Water-Every-Day" title="Drink More Water Every Day">Drink plenty of water</a>.</b> Staying hydrated with basic H<sub>2</sub>O is an easy and dramatic way to improve your health. Drinking enough water can also help with weight loss by keeping your stomach feeling full. Drink water before, during and after a meal to aid digestion.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you feel like snacking, try drinking a full glass of water first. If you're still hungry 15 minutes after your drink, then it's time for a snack.</li>
<li>Carry water with you so you can easily pick it up when you're thirsty.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_f6151a1111" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f6151a1111')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Avoid sugary drinks.</b> These include soft drinks, juices, sports and energy drinks, as well as other products containing artificial sweeteners. Giving up sugary drinks is one of the easiest ways you can instantly improve your diet and become healthier. A white chocolate crème frappuccino has whopping 500 calories.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup> While it's okay to treat yourself with these and other drinks every once in a while, it's not a good idea to make them a regular part of your diet.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_dc5e6226f4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_dc5e6226f4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Consider participating in <i>Meatless Mondays</i>.</b> Meatless Monday is an international campaign that encourages people to give up eating meat one day per week. Eating less meat can have several health benefits, as most people already have enough protein in their diets.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" height="410" id="img_895c9bba13" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_895c9bba13')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stay away from fast food.</b> As we all know fast food is bad for our health, yet it continues to remain a weekly staple for too many people. For one, fast food is often fried, processed, and excessively salty. Add soft drinks and fries and your meal could easily burn through half of your suggested caloric intake for the day. To add insult to injury, much of the fat contained in fast food is trans-fat, the worst kind of fat.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_c463a68a08" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c463a68a08')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Reduce your alcohol intake.</b> Excessive alcohol consumption makes you gain weight and is hard for the liver to process leading to a host of preventable diseases. Drinking in moderation is key, if you do consume alcohol, consider drink a glass of wine or beer with your meal as opposed to multiple drinks at a bar.

<ul>
<li>Red wine, in particular, contains polyphenol, called resveratrol that scientists believe is particularly heart-healthy. Resveratrol improves the function of blood vessels in the heart and curbs the amount of "bad" cholesterol in your body.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Are you pregnant and worried about drinking? Doctors recommend expectant mothers to abstain from alcohol.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Changing_Your_Mindset_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Changing_Your_Mindset">Changing Your Mindset</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Eat-Healthy-Step-12.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-12.jpg" height="485" id="img_8976694b49" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_8976694b49')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Eat-Healthy-Step-12.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Adopt a healthy attitude towards food.</b> Take a hard look at your eating habits. Do you eat more when you feel stressed?<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup> Do you withhold food from yourself in order to feel like you're in control? Try to evaluate whether you have an unhealthy emotional attachment to food. If you do, here are few steps to consider:

<ul>
<li>Find a healthier replacement. If you find that you tend to gorge on unhealthy foods when you're stressed, find a substitute activity — for instance, you could instead go for a walk, take a long bath, or call a trusted friend for a chat. Whatever you choose, it should be something that helps you to decompress, so that you no longer feel the need to binge.</li>
<li>See food as sustenance. A lot of Western culture is rife with messages that food is for entertainment or for relieving boredom. Break yourself of this cognitive habit by consciously evaluating food in terms of what it can do to keep your body healthy. Ask yourself if what you're about to put in your mouth is good for you, and if it will help your body function as it was designed to.</li>
<li>Consult a medical professional. Eating disorders are classified as mental illnesses, and you can't always just talk yourself into stopping destructive behaviors. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup> If you suspect that you have an eating disorder (whether it's over- or under-eating), ask your general practitioner to refer you the appropriate care.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Eat-Healthy-Step-13.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-13.jpg" height="485" id="img_df99ea0b6f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_df99ea0b6f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Eat-Healthy-Step-13.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Calculate-Your-Total-Daily-Calorie-Needs" title="Calculate Your Total Daily Calorie Needs">Determine how many calories your body needs</a> to function each day.</b> This number can vary widely, depending upon your metabolism and how physically active you are. As a rule, the more muscle mass you have, the more calories you need to consume and to function properly. Otherwise, your body will start breaking down muscle tissue for energy.

<ul>
<li>If you're the kind of person who puts on 10 pounds just smelling a slice of pizza, then your daily caloric intake should stay around 2000 calories for men, and 1500 calories for women. Your body mass also plays a part in this — more calories are suitable for naturally bigger people, and fewer calories for smaller people.</li>
<li>If you're the kind of person who can eat without putting on a pound, or you're physically active, you may want to increase your daily caloric intake by 1000-2000 calories, a little less for women.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Eat-Healthy-Step-14.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-14.jpg" height="532" id="img_ce8a6deac7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ce8a6deac7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="532" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Eat-Healthy-Step-14.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Feel-Like-Eating-Breakfast-First-Thing-in-the-Morning" title="Feel Like Eating Breakfast First Thing in the Morning">Don't skip breakfast</a>.</b> Many people do this because they think they can drop pound, or they just don't feel hungry in the morning. Although the scientific evidence is still inconclusive<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>, there are several reasons why you might not want to skip what many people believe is the "most important meal of the day".

<ul>
<li>Eating breakfast gets your metabolism going and keeps it active throughout the morning. This will keep you energized throughout the morning.</li>
<li>Skipping breakfast might leave you famished by lunch, causing you to binge as a way to compensate.</li>
<li>A small breakfast is better than no breakfast. If you don't feel up to a full meal, at least drink some water and eat a piece of fruit, a granola bar, or a piece of toast. Get more nutritious bang for your buck by eating a <a href="/Make-a-Smoothie" title="Make a Smoothie">breakfast smoothie</a>.</li>
<li>Avoid skipping breakfast at the day of an important exam, job interview, or other critical event, where you may be distracted by your hunger or not have enough energy for your brain to work to its full potential.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Eat slowly.</b> Have you ever gorged on a huge meal and felt fine immediately after, but felt like exploding 15 minutes later? This happens because it takes some time for your stomach to tell your brain that it's full. Circumvent the problem by consuming your food slower. That way, by the time you get the message and start feeling satisfied, you haven't consumed extra food.<br/><br/><ul>
<li>Slow yourself down by waiting 5 or 10 minutes between each course. Chew each bite thoroughly
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet1.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet1.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 15Bullet1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet1.jpg" height="485" id="img_fd7b6d2445" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fd7b6d2445')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 15Bullet1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet1.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
<li>Drink a full glass of water throughout your meal. Stopping for sips will slow your eating, as well as help you feel more full.</li>
<li>Put your fork down between bites. This is a physical reminder to finish the food in your mouth before taking another bite.
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 15Bullet2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet2.jpg" height="485" id="img_f329b243bd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f329b243bd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 15Bullet2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-15Bullet2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg?ajax=true&aid=10794" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg" height="485" id="img_e347042356" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e347042356')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Eat five times per day.</b> You may consider eating three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner), with two snacks in between. Doing this allows you to eat slightly less at your meals, giving your body a more manageable amount of food to digest, and keeps your blood sugar at a consistent level throughout the day.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Help_Selecting_Healthy_Foods_and_Meals_sub"></a><div class="section steps sample sticky">

<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="10794" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs qa_waittheresmore" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="197667" data-caid="198540" data-cqid="197684" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="426954" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="105250" data-votes_down="23" data-votes_up="92">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is it healthy to eat anything or as much as I want but until 6 pm only? For example, when the clock strikes at 6, I would only drink water until I go to sleep.</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=patriciasomers%2Crd#patriciasomers%2Crd" style="background-image: url(/images/thumb/6/66/Patricia-Somers.jpg/-crop-200-200-200px-Patricia-Somers.jpg)" target="_blank">
</a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">
<a class="sp_namelink" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=patriciasomers%2Crd#patriciasomers%2Crd" target="_blank">Patricia Somers, RD</a><br/>
	Registered Dietitian
</div>
Patricia Somers is a Registered Dietitian in Arkansas. She received her RD from the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics in 1979.
</div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=patriciasomers%2Crd#patriciasomers%2Crd" style="background-image: url(/images/thumb/6/66/Patricia-Somers.jpg/-crop-200-200-200px-Patricia-Somers.jpg)" target="_blank">
</a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">
<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=patriciasomers%2Crd#patriciasomers%2Crd" target="_blank">Patricia Somers, RD</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Registered Dietitian</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">No. While not eating at night is a good idea, you should be eating a healthy diet all day long. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>23</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>92</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="186301" data-caid="187174" data-cqid="186318" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1198394" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="7" data-votes_up="61">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What can I do if I don't care about eating healthy?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Then you must think again. Eating unhealthy will have a bad effect on your health, so you should learn what kinds of diseases and ailments you may experience if you don't eat healthy. This might convince you to take your health more seriously.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>7</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>61</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="22639" data-caid="23512" data-cqid="22656" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="6519" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="26" data-votes_up="151">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What are the best foods for children to eat for breakfast?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Oatmeal/porridge and fruit can be the healthy option. Porridge/oatmeal is good because it gives energy and keeps children warm throughout the day. Having fruit on the porridge/oatmeal gives extra energy and some vitamin C, depending on how much fruit is eaten.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>26</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>151</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="37091" data-caid="37964" data-cqid="37108" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="51718" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="33" data-votes_up="168">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I gain weight if I eat the proper amount of calories that I need?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">If you don't exercise, yes. If you do exercise, then no. You need to have a balance of exercise and healthy eating.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>33</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>168</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="23375" data-caid="24248" data-cqid="23392" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="7118" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="35" data-votes_up="171">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is it okay to eat junk foods once in a while?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, it's okay to eat some junk as a treat, but not every single night. Some junk food also comes with carrot sticks or celery and cucumber and this is often a good option to "mop up" the fats.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>35</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>171</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="53857" data-caid="54730" data-cqid="53874" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="176276" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="20" data-votes_up="105">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What can a 14 year old do for weight management?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Don't do anything too harsh to yourself. Try to live life normally, eat right, and get regular exercise. When it comes to exercise, there's no need for hardcore gym sessions. Just go outside and play or run around, and consider trying out for school sports teams. If you want to explore specific diet or exercise routines, make sure to have your parents talk to your doctor about it first.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>20</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>105</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="63503" data-caid="64376" data-cqid="63520" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="120486" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="23" data-votes_up="115">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How many days will it take me to lose weight?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">That depends on a few factors, including your body type, your metabolism, and how diligent you are about eating healthy. It might take you 1 week or 6 months -- it just depends on you.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>23</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>115</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="54069" data-caid="54942" data-cqid="54086" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="379326" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="15" data-votes_up="81">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do I keep up with what I have eaten? </div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Write a list. This is really simple to do. Each time you make a meal or go out for dinner, record in a notebook or on your phone exactly what you ate.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>15</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>81</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="178280" data-caid="179153" data-cqid="178297" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="623949" data-submitter_id="3995114" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="12" data-votes_up="59">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is rice a healthy food?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_ta_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/images/avatarOut/5/55/3995114.jpg?20180513040416)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Caeiia">Caeiia</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Top Answerer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Refined white rice doesn't have fiber or nutrients, but has a lot of starch. Brown rice has more fiber and nutrients. There are other healthier starches than rice out there. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>12</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>59</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="63825" data-caid="64698" data-cqid="63842" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="512210" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="17" data-votes_up="69">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What healthy foods are good to eat in winter?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Scratch made vegetable soup is very healthy and will help to warm you up. You can make it in large quantities and make a lot of meals out of it. You might also look up recipes for healthy chili or chicken stew.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>17</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>69</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Non-fat yogurt can make a great snack, and its healthy bacteria can help with various stomach problems. However, high sugar levels can negate any benefit from eating yogurt.</li>
<li>Try chewing more. This will give your body more time to digest the food and absorb nutrients.</li>
<li>Have patience. You won't see a drastic drop in your cholesterol level or weight or increase in your energy level immediately. You need to give the changes in diet some time to kick in. You may start to notice changes a couple weeks later.</li>
<li>Eat before you shop so you can focus on your grocery list without having any unnecessary cravings.</li>
<li>With labels such as "fat free" or "sugar free" there are more chemicals. Most of the time, the simpler the ingredients list, the healthier the food is. For example, juicing your own orange juice is always healthier than store bought orange juice, even if its labeled fat free. If you make juice at home, you know exactly what is in the juice and not relying on a label to be truthful.</li>
<li>Cravings for junk food usually stop after about 2 weeks of eating healthy.</li>
<li>Try to lower your processed junk food consumption (chips, cookies, bread, crackers).</li>
<li>Make sure there isn't a lot of unhealthy food in your house that can tempt you. Give or throw away the foods you shouldn't eat.</li>
<li>Losing weight shouldn't always be about your appearance, it's also about your health.</li>
<li>Try making your own flavorings instead of buying unhealthy sauce for flavor.</li>
<li>Eat smaller portions, use a smaller plate to encourage smaller portions.</li>
<li>Eat lots of green vegetables,</li>
<li>Set S.M.A.R.T. goals that are Simple, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic, and Time based.</li>
<li>If you have an urge to eat unhealthy at certain times of day, recognize that it is a trigger. Distract yourself until the craving passes.</li>
<li>Proper nutrition is a lifestyle choice.</li>
<li>Instead of limiting foods, replace them. If you like sweet cookies, try sweet strawberries or blueberries. If you like chips, try unsalted popcorn. Think about all the foods you can eat, instead of dwelling on the foods you are trying not to eat.</li>
<li>Starving yourself leads to weight gain and other health problems. If you want to lose weight, try working out or eating non-fatty foods.</li>
<li>Keep a food diary with a notepad or an app, like iEatWell or Fooducate.</li>
<li>Eating well is rewarding. You will likely feel better, sleep better, and you'll find your digestive system to be more consistent.</li>
<li>Don't be fooled to eat when your friends are eating. Refrain from eating when you are not hungry and focus on your end goal.</li>
<li>Don’t cut out major food groups if you don’t need to. For example, cutting out wheat/gluten, if you don’t get enough calories you will become anorexic.</li>
<li>Don’t eat too much at a restaurant; if you have leftovers, take them home.</li>
<li>Make a list of healthy foods and/or easy, quick, and yummy recipes containing them; stick to that list as much as possible.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>When creating your new diet, start by replacing simple carbs like sugar with complex carbs like vegetables and whole grains. Then, replace food items that contain trans and saturated fats with ones that have monounsaturated fats, like nuts, and omega-3 fatty acids, like eggs. Eat fish, chicken, and beans to make sure your body is getting enough protein, and stay away from sugary drinks, salty food, and fast food whenever possible. <span id="summary_last_sentence">For tips from our reviewer on how to change your eating patterns and determine your daily calorie goals, read on!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

/* global mw, WH, MachinifyAPI*/
document.addEventListener( 'DOMContentLoaded', function () {
	var banner = document.getElementById( 'campaign-adBanner' );
	var widget = document.getElementById( 'campaign-desktopWidget' );
	if ( mw.user.isAnon() && !window._ads || ( banner && widget && banner.offsetHeight == 0 ) ) {
		var root = '/extensions/wikihow/Honeypot/campaigns/support/';
		var sources = [
			{ ref: 'small', srcset: [ root + 'small@1x.png 300w', root + 'small@2x.png 600w', root + 'small@3x.png 900w' ] },
			{ ref: 'large', srcset: [ root + 'large@1x.png 300w', root + 'large@2x.png 600w', root + 'large@3x.png 900w' ] },
		];
		var index = Math.floor( Math.random() * sources.length );
		var ref = sources[index].ref;
		var link = document.getElementById( 'campaign-link' );
		var image = document.getElementById( 'campaign-image' );
		var target = '/wikiHow:Contribute';
		// Pass extra data to the campaign special page
		if ( target.indexOf( '/Special:Campaign/' ) == 0 ) {
			target += '?ref=' + encodeURIComponent( ref ) +
				'&origin=' + encodeURIComponent( location.pathname );
		}
		widget.style.display = 'block';
		image.setAttribute( 'srcset', sources[index].srcset.join() );
		link.setAttribute( 'href', target ); 
		link.onclick = function ( e ) {
			e.preventDefault();
			// Track click
			WH.maEvent(
				'support_ad_click',
				{ origin: location.hostname, ref: ref },
				function () {
					window.location = link.getAttribute( 'href' );
				}
			);
		};
		image.onload = function () {
			// Track view
			var done = false;
			var interval = setInterval( function () {
				if ( !done && MachinifyAPI ) {
					done = true;
					WH.maEvent( 'support_ad_view', { origin: location.hostname, ref: ref } );
					clearInterval( interval );
				}
			}, 100 );
		};
	}
} );

    "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
    "@type": "HowTo",
    "headline": "Eat Healthy",
    "name": "Eat Healthy",
    "mainEntityOfPage": {
        "@type": "WebPage",
        "id": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/Eat-Healthy"
    },
    "image": {
        "@type": "ImageObject",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/34\/Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg\/aid10794-v4-1200px-Eat-Healthy-Step-16.jpg",
        "width": 1200,
        "height": 800
    },
    "author": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },
        "sameAs": [
            "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/wikiHow\/",
            "https:\/\/twitter.com\/wikiHow",
            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/company\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/user\/WikiHow"
        ]
    },
    "aggregateRating": {
        "@type": "AggregateRating",
        "bestRating": 100,
        "ratingCount": 57,
        "ratingValue": 76
    },
    "datePublished": "2005-06-24",
    "dateModified": "2019-03-29",
    "publisher": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },
        "sameAs": [
            "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/wikiHow\/",
            "https:\/\/twitter.com\/wikiHow",
            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",
